OR... - from same place, highlight the incoming and outgoing rows and delete.

content:
Do you have more than one user auto deleting mail on fetch using POP3, sharing a pop3 account.

That would cause the error big time. Users can not share a POP mail account and delete messages from the server. These errors are what occurs, especially if someone deletes the mail after the server presents the list of available mail on the initial connection.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
What list?

Spam/Junk is a mathematical process based on the contents of the message against a locally generated database of text fragments based on your training over time (in my case decades) The learning algorithm uses those fragments as tokens to determine is text is SPAMMY or not, when a preset number is achieved the mail is considered junk/spam. It has nothing at all to do with the from address so there is no "SPAMMERS" address list.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Could be caused by forced closure! You might even have corrupt files from ending stuff while it is trying to update something.

I would suggest turning Thunderbird to offline mode acknowledging the error and see if it comes good overnight.

You might also try deleting the global index, as that can get corrupted and out of sync with reality. It can also see things that should occur in seconds take many minutes once it is out of sync. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database

content:
Achiving is within the IMAP account by default. I have no personal experience with apple anything. I refuse to may the extra. However archiving in gmail requires you to leave the mail in the IMAP account. Otherwise archiving does nothing and offers no errors. The server just ignores the command. It would not surprise me at all if Apple did exactly the same thing. Even if you manage to get an archive of gmail somewhere else, gmail still keeps it in the all mail folder, because in their setup that is the archive.

As for the unsubscribe, that sounds like the process of deleting the archived mail is still in progress, (how many thousands of mails are in the queue? That would prevent Thunderbird from accessing other folders when it was to get mail as all available connections would already be in use trying to sync the mass deletion. Showing only the basic inbox and things like deleted is a classic sign of connectivity issues with IMAP accounts.

If you have an apple phone or tablet also connected to that mail, turn them off (overnight perhaps) and that will help the backlog as they have no connection limiting and each will prevent connection from other devices while they do their own sync.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
It sounds a lot to me like your bank is using a unicode font in the email and your apple product is converting that to some other non unicode font in the copy and paste.

The question marks arise when the font being used does not have a corresponding character for the underlying character number. It is becoming increasingly so that large institutions and corporations have a "corporate livery" they include in emails, including downloadable web fonts. Of course apple does not have the same fonts even as Windows, so it may be your bank has not even tested their email on apple desktops/Laptops, it really only represents a very small percentage of any market (about 7-8% worldwide), and how many of their Apple using customers copy and paste the email content anywhere to report it as a problem?

content:
contactus7 said
We have verified it is nothing on our sever, as we can login directly on our server webmail service, and on other browser based email logins (gmail). We have verified server settings, port numbers, etc.

I think you have not actually demonstrated anything with your test of web mail. One is a web page, and your issue is with mail.

Personally I think you answered your own question'

It is only happening with one inbox, it's a general inbox that multiple (5-6) users access. What's going on here?

IMAP servers have a limit to the number of concurrent logins that they will support. Generally Thunderbird will use up to 5, apple mail on an iphone will just keep connecting until it is refused. These multiple connections make things happen faster and allow for say an expunge on one folder while message headers are retrieved for another folder and finally a message is displayed because you selected it.

Thunderbird has controls on the number of connections for each account in the advanced button in server settings for the account. But I think your issue is actually more involved. It maybe that the total connections for a single rackspace mail account is 25 (your stated 5 users at Thunderbird's default 5 connections.) This means you will have to reduce the connections per user to stay within the limit, but as you decrease the number of connections things slow down. Then if you get a sixth user then the whole issue come up again, and again for a seventh. I suggest oyu determine exactly what server limit you are working within.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Dates follow the operating system locale. It is most certainly not hard coded. Being force fed mm-DD date formats would have this Aussie firing chips at all Mozilla and Mzla employees that poked their heads up. Interestingly these types of questions most often come from Linux users where open source has led to setting a system locale being a chore and setting such details in your chosen windowing environment does not necessarily affect the system locale.

I suggest you check with your distribution how to check your locale and set it, including the date formats.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I will preempt this by saying I have my own personal issues with supernova. I am not an evangelist.

The first thing to consider is what software on your computer might be in a position to make a program think it has no disk space and can not open files? Everyone jumps to "malware" but in reality if you have a third party antivirus, or internet security suite, it is probably the issue.

Yes I am taking your issues out of order, but I think that that is the key issue. Repopulating something from a disk file being slow is probably related to the inability to read and write to the disk. Beyond the simplicity of the antivirus being the issue (restarting the operating system in safe mode with networking ios considered the standard diagnostic to eliminate outside influences like Av and other software like cloud sync and streaming backups which can also mimic no file access.

When it comes to folder counts of unread and total messages. Unread messages in sub folders are included in the count for their parent when collapsed as demonstrated below in a trash folder.

If you want to have a discussion about a crash, please provide the submitted crash report id so we can look at it. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/mozilla-crash-reporter-tb#w_viewing-crash-reports
creator: MattAuSupport
